page.title: 01Vlges.-Farmland Nr Mkt H'bor
page.content: Two small villages, Brampton Ash & Dingley are set in low hills south of the fertile Welland Valley. Most of the farmland is owned by London merchant/bankers and rented out. Fourfamilies own and farm the remainder. Some local inhabitants work on the farms; others are employed at Dingley Hall, an Elizabethan House divided into flats. Several work in nearby towns and one or two commute to London, returning at weekends only. The proportion of retired people living in the area is increasing. As there are no local industries, shops, post offices or public houses, the two village churches and the common village hall are the focus of social life and contribute to a genuine feeling of community. There area some attractive old farmhouses, a lovely rectory and a perfect setting
